title: Update local admin gate username to ADMIN and invalidate old unlock state

requirements.summary: Change the local-only admin username gate to unlock only on exact, case-sensitive match to "ADMIN".
acceptanceCriteria: Admin mode unlock succeeds when the user enters exactly "ADMIN".
Admin mode unlock fails for "admin", "Admin", "ADMIN " (trailing space), or any other non-exact value.
All existing admin-only UI remains gated by the updated admin unlock condition.

file_operations.description: Update the configured ADMIN_USERNAME constant to "ADMIN" (case-sensitive exact match).
Ensure the unlock check continues to compare the raw entered value exactly against the configured ADMIN_USERNAME (no trimming/case normalization), so only exact "ADMIN" unlocks.

requirements.summary: Invalidate any previously persisted admin-unlocked state when the configured admin username changes.
acceptanceCriteria: After updating the admin username to "ADMIN", a user who was previously in an unlocked admin state is no longer unlocked on page reload until they enter "ADMIN" again.
Locking admin mode still clears the local persisted admin-unlocked state.

file_operations.description: Revise ADMIN_GATE_STORAGE_KEY to be derived from (or versioned with) the configured admin username so that changing the username results in a new persistence key and the old unlocked state is not reused.

Wire the updated ADMIN_GATE_STORAGE_KEY into Zustand persist configuration and confirm the lock action keeps persisting the locked state (so admin lock reliably clears the persisted unlocked flag for the active key).
